intro: Oncoba spinosa subsp. sidamensis, commonly known as the Sidamensis spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is known for its diverse and often toxic species. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural study and conservation efforts.
